column1: keatonpatti 160888469779 "2017-05-20 23:06:27 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160888469779/tuxedo " “Hi
column2: I’d like to rent a tuxedo. I’m up for an award.” “Wow! What for?” “Best Owned Tuxedo.” “Shouldn’t you buy one then?” “Shouldn’t you shut the fuck up?” “I have a disease where if I don’t talk
column3: I die.” “Sucks to be you
column4: but at least you don’t have a disease where if you’re an idiot
column5: you die
column6: because then you’d already be dead.” “Not funny. My brother had that disease.” “So he’s dead?” “No
column7: he cured himself because he’s a fucking genius.” “Wow. Cool.” “Yeah
column8: he created Dance Dance Revolution.” “Dang. He’s definitely going to heaven.” “Yeah
column9: God already emailed him telling him that he’s in.” “Sweet. What’s God’s email?” “XxXGoodxxCharlotteXxX@hotmail.com” “Wow
column10: so the bible was right.”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 160815676209 "2017-05-18 21:29:33 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160815676209/act " “You’ve never heard of the act?” “No. Describe it to me.” “Um. Okay. So there’s these men. They’re all blue.” “Blue costumes? Like those morphsuits?” “No. Um. Well their skin is all blue. They actually wear black.” “Black isn’t very blue.” “Yeah
column2: but their skin is REALLY blue.” “Okay. What do they do?” “Hmm…well they play music with unconventional instruments.” “What are we talking about? Like blue guitars?” “No. Like pipes. And gadgets they make. Imagine if Home Depot was a music store.” “It’s not.” “Just imagine.” “Okay.” “That’s where they’d buy all their instruments. And they do comedy too.” “Is it blue?” “No
column3: surprisingly not.” “Wow. And what did you say the name of these guys was?” “Penn & Teller.” “Now those are names!”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 160588657309 "2017-05-12 16:13:24 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160588657309/line " “Is this the line to audition for American Idol?” “No
column2: this is the line to check out at Whole Foods.” “Oh
column3: crap. Thanks!” “Hahaha. Sucker! This IS the line to audition for American Idol. One less person standing in my way!” “Huh? I’m still standing right next to you. So this is the line?” “Nope
column4: sorry
column5: buddy. This is the line for tickets to see Sting vs the Police.” “You mean Sting and the Police?” “No
column6: this isn’t a concert
column7: it’s a boxing match pitting Sting against the Police. 3 on 1
column8: really not fair
column10: weird. But it’s definitely not the line to audition for American Idol
column12: that’s a few blocks down.” “Gotcha. Thanks!” “Yeah
column13: no problem…Moron! Hahahaha! I shall be the next American Idol!” “You were still talking to me when you went all maniacal.“ ""Huh? Oh. No
column14: I don’t think I was.” “That’s it! Whatever this line is
column15: I’m getting in it.” “Curses! My plan is ruined!”  The two waited in line for hours. In the end it was actually the line  to find out if a glass shoe fit their feet
column17: to become a  princess. The shoe fit them both
column18: but the prince said that was weird and  called off the contest. Sting still hasn’t fought the Police. What a  pussy.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 160561836759 "2017-05-11 21:13:26 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160561836759/wine " “This bottle of wine is from the year I was born.” “Wow. What if when you were born you two were switched at birth?” “You mean what if I was switched with a bottle of wine at birth?”  “Yeah. Wouldn’t that be wild? You were supposed to have its life: being  fermented in a barrel
column2: bottled and sold and then never opened. It was  supposed to have your life: being raised in Canada
column3: playing hockey as a  kid
column4: killing Princess Diana without anyone knowing
column5: and then collecting  wine.” “I told you not to mention that Princess Diana thing again.” “Who said that? You or the bottle of wine?” “I did!” “I can’t tell which of you is which!” “Where’d you get that gun?!” “Bought it online! Pretty nice right? It was made the same year I was born.” “Wow. What if when you were born you two were-” The man with the gun fired twice
column6: shattering the wine bottle and killing the other man. “He knew too much
column7: ” said the man. “Way too much
column8: ” said the gun. *Gary and the Gun will be back after this commercial break*  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 160494437814 "2017-05-09 23:06:58 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160494437814/mickey " “Normally you’d have more training
column2: but there’s been an emergency.  You’re playing Mickey. You don’t talk. You bop around like a giant  mouse
column3: got it?” “Is the costume hot?” “Not too bad.” “Can I eat any of the kids?” “NO!” “Can I take pictures with the kids?” “Yes.” “Can I put this on my resume?” “…sure.” “Under the ‘Places I’ve Eaten Kids’ section?” “NO!” “Can I interact with the other characters?” “Yes
column4: but only if it makes sense for Mickey to interact with them.” “Gotcha. So I can hang with Goofy?” “Sure.” “And I can take pictures together with Goofy?” “Yeah.” “And we can eat a few children together?” “NO!!! NO EATING CHILDREN!!! Jesus!” “Okay
column5: no need to blow up at me. Remember
column6: I never had the ‘Don’t Eat Kids’ part of training.” “You’re right. We really gotta make that Day 1.”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 160429068109 "2017-05-08 03:13:30 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160429068109/coat "keatonpatti:Once the seedy motel door was shut
column2: the salesman opened up his trench coat and revealed to the customer the numerous pockets full of guns. Pistols
column3: sub-machine guns
column4: and full-time-machine guns caught the customer’s eye. The salesman knew he was enticed. “As you can see this is a great quality trench coat just chocked full of pockets. It has buttons and a belt so it won’t just fall off of you like some coats. Plus
column5: as you can see
column6: it also works in non-trench situations.” “It’s a wonderful coat
column7: but why all the guns?” “Those are in case you don’t want to buy the coat.” “Oh. Well I do want to buy it.” “Perfect.” The customer handed the salesman a wad of coins. After removing the guns
column8: the salesman handed over the trench coat. “Fits like a charm! Hey
column9: how are you going to carry all of those guns? Do you need a bag? I have a bag. I work in bag development.” “No
column10: that’s okay. I figured I’d make a sale today
column11: so I called another trench coat salesman to meet me here in a bit so I can buy his trench coat to carry the guns.” “Wow
column12: that’s thinking ahead. But won’t he have guns that he’ll then have to carry?” “No
column13: the guns are my thing. He fills his pockets with knives.” “Oh
column14: but won’t he then have a bunch of knives he’ll need to carry?” “Nah

column1: keatonpatti 160351560674 "2017-05-06 00:22:20 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160351560674/valet " I was a valet at a pretty fancy restaurant for a few months and there  was this guy that would come in with a different crazy expensive car  every single week. One time I finally said to him that he must be really  rich to be able to afford to have so many nice cars. He just laughed  and said he wasn’t rich and that he stole those cars for joyrides and  only brought them to the valet so there would be another set of  fingerprints on the steering wheel to confuse the police into arresting  the wrong guy. I was about to say that that was still kinda cool
column2: but  the cops had me in the back of the car by then. Now I valet in prison  and it’s really easy because nobody has a car.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 160235417839 "2017-05-02 18:20:46 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160235417839/mystery " There used to be an ice cream shop near me that had a mystery flavor. It  was kept in the back and you couldn’t even look at it unless you  ordered it. One day I felt adventurous and ordered it. The employee went  to the back and came out with a 6-year-old kid and said the mystery  flavor was this kid and now I had to raise him as my own and send him to  chess camp and treat the diabetes he got from living in an ice cream  shop and only eating ice cream for breakfast
column2: lunch
column3: dinner
column4: and fourth meal (©Taco Bell). I said no way in hell was I gonna raise  an ice cream kid
column5: especially since I ordered the mystery flavor ON A  CONE and there was no cone to be found. The employee said the kid ate  the cone already and
column6: since that seemed like something a son of mine  would do
column7: I decided to keep the little guy. I handed the employee a $5  bill and the second I did
column8: the kid pulled out a badge and arrested me  for child trafficking. Can you believe that??? My little guy’s a cop!!!  So proud.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 160202833719 "2017-05-01 20:44:41 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/160202833719/red-nose "“Sir
column2: your total is $11.23. Also
column3: would you like to donate a dollar to the Red Nose fund?”“What’s that? Money for like sending a clown to college or something?”“No
column4: it’s actually-”“If it’s not for sending a clown to college
column5: I refuse to donate.”“Well
column6: it’s a great cause that really-”“-really sends a clown to a Top 10 college that normally the clown couldn’t afford?”“…no. That’s fine
column7: sir. You don’t have to donate. Please swipe your card.”“I’m paying cash.”“Please swipe your cash.”“It’s chip cash.”“Please insert the chip.”“I think I pulled it out too soon.”“That’s what he said!”“Hahaha. That’s funny. Are you a clown? If so I’ll pay for you to go to college.”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 159991476144 "2017-04-25 22:40:45 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159991476144/touch " I used to work at the museum as the guy that told people not to touch  the mummies. It was normally easy because most people are respectful or  too stupid to realize that the mummies could be touched
column2: but one old  woman came in every year on the same day and made my job tough. She wore  a shirt that said “#1 Mummy Toucher” and didn’t even look at the other  exhibits
column3: even though we had some cool ones like King Arthur’s round  tablecloth and Kennedy’s novel about the Matrix. This woman  would hop right over the velvet “do not hop over” rope and make a  bee-line for the most touchable mummy. One year I was a step ahead of  her and dressed up as that mummy
column4: so when she went to touch me I grabbed  her hand and said
column5: “Don’t touch the mumm-ME!” and laughed and laughed.  She didn’t think it was very funny though and had a big heart attack and  died on the spot. I didn’t want to get in trouble so I threw her into  one of the empty mummy sarcophagi. I think she’s still there today.  Anyway
column6: obviously I got promoted from that job to tour guide
column7: so if  you’ll follow me
column8: we’ll check out Kennedy’s novel that caused the  Wachowskis to kill him.  " True text

column4: they’re just like us
column5: kid.” “Well
column6: they actually play those pipes and instruments
column7: right?” “Haha! So naive. Nah
column8: kid
column9: that’s all a backing track. They just pretend to play during the show.” “Well
column12: foolish excuse for a child. Of course not! They’re women. All of them. Always have been.” “Well
column13: at least they’re a group. They’re not lying about that!” “HA HA HA HA HA LOL HAHA LOL LOL HAHAH. Actually
column15: that’s right. They are a group.” “Did you just say ‘LOL’ out loud?” “Nah

column1: keatonpatti 159814457364 "2017-04-21 04:08:56 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159814457364/mr-bond " “Do you expect me to talk?” “No
column2: Mr. Bond. I expect you to talk! Mwahahaha.” “Did you mean to say something other than talk right there?” “Huh? What? Huh again?”  “Well I asked if you expected me to talk and you said no
column3: that you  expected me to talk. So you either meant to say yes
column4: you expected me to  talk
column5: or no
column6: that you expected me to do anything but talk
column7: but you said  talk.” “I didn’t say that!” “You did.” “Bah! Enough of this! You’re a talking man
column8: Mr. Bond!” “Did you mean to say dead man? That I’m a dead man because you’re gonna kill me?” “That’s what I said!” “You said talking man.” “Impossible! You’re trying to trick me
column9: Mr. Bond! I can’t be tricked! On his talkbed
column10: my father told me to never be tricked!” “Talkbed? You mean deathbed? I think you confuse the words talk and die
column12: and their various uses.” “Die to the hand
column14: cause the face don’t give a damn!”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 159758822599 "2017-04-19 17:29:17 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159758822599/kids " “So this is the living room. Big
column2: right? In your price range
column3: this place is a steal.” “How’s the school district in the area?” “Oh
column4: you have kids?” “No.” “Planning on kids?” “No.” “Heard of kids?” “No.” “Were a kid once?” “No.” “You’re Kid Rock?” “I wish.” “Wish granted.” “I can smell a pig from a mile away.” “Luckily this house is located 1.1 miles away from the nearest pig.” “I’ll take it!”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 159723644704 "2017-04-18 18:32:24 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159723644704/fusion " I used to be a waiter at a Mexican-Chinese fusion restaurant. All of the  food was Mexican. The menus were all in Spanish. It was called Mexico.  It was in Mexico. The only Chinese thing about it was that we gave out  fortune cookies after the meals. I told the owner that didn’t seem like  much of a fusion
column2: and he said how did I know anything about fusion
column3: and I  said I knew all about fusion
column4: and he said how was that possible because  when I interviewed for the job I said I didn’t know  anything about fusion
column5: and I said well people change
column6: that interview  was over a week ago and in that time I learned all about fusion
column7: and he  said well what did you learn
column8: and I told him what I learned
column10: you learned all that in a week
column11: and I said over a week
column13: and he still said wow that’s a lot to learn
column15: well are you gonna stop calling the place a Mexican-Chinese fusion  restaurant
column17: and that in fact he was gonna call it a  Mexican-Chinese-German fusion restaurant from that point on
column18: and I asked  what was gonna be German about it
column19: and he said he was firing me and  hiring a German waiter
column20: and I said that’s bullshit since I’m already  German
column21: and he asked how that could be since in my job interview I said I  wasn’t any part German
column22: and I reminded him that was over a week ago
column25: that’s right. The owner gave me a fortune  cookie after that talk and it said
column27: ” but he said he  didn’t know what it was gonna say since it was just a random cookie he  grabbed and that of course I wasn’t fired. He gave me another cookie and  it said
column28: “Why don’t Presidents fight the war? Why do they always send  the poor?” I said that was a System of a Down song lyric and he said  good
column29: songs need lyrics. He’s right.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 159616161689 "2017-04-15 22:28:05 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159616161689/civil-war " I used to give tours of an old Civil War battleground. I memorized a script with a bunch of facts and dates in it
column2: but people would always ask questions I couldn’t answer. One man once asked me
column3: “If the Civil War was fought today
column4: who would date my son?” and pointed at a 16-year-old boy in the tour. I hadn’t memorized that fact
column5: so I just said
column6: “Abraham Lincoln would.” That same tour an old lady asked me
column7: “If the South had won the war
column8: would I have an iPhone 6s instead of this lousy 5c?” I wasn’t 100% positive
column11: I’m 100% positive you would.” After her
column13: “Did Lincoln make sure the Civil War was fought back then instead of today so that he wouldn’t have to date me?” A lot of people said “Good question” after that (hell even I did) and then waited for my answer. I didn’t want to tell the truth and say yes
column14: so I said what I always said at the end of the tours
column16: you’ll see our gift shop. It features a wide assortment of rock candy and candy rocks. If you mention my name to the cashier
column17: she’ll tell you that won’t get you a discount.” I quit that job when I got fired.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 159589605674 "2017-04-15 04:12:09 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159589605674/flowers " “I’d like to buy some flowers for my wife.” “Wonderful! Do you know what types of flowers she likes?” “What are those ones in American Beauty?” “Roses.” “She likes those. And what about in that Black Dahlia movie?” “Uh
column2: dahlias?” “Yes
column3: she loves dahlias. And then what about the things in March of the Penguins?” “Penguins?” “Yes
column4: she adores those. A dozen penguins will do. And then what about those ones in Being John Malkovich?” “John Malkovichs?” “My wife can’t get enough of those. What colors do they come in?’ “White.” “White works. Oh
column5: and finally
column6: what are those guys from Anaconda: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid?” “I’m guessing you’re referring to anacondas?” “Yes! My wife is all about anacondas! A bouquet of those as well!” “Of course
column7: sir.” “When will all the flowers be ready?” “Whenever you wake up from your coma
column8: sir.” “Hahaha! What
column9: did you talk with the chocolate shop guy across the street? He used the same joke on me right before this!” “No
column10: sir. You’re in a coma. You need to wake up.” “…no. It can’t be.” “But it is
column11: sir. You must wake up! YOU MUST WAKE UP! WAKE UP!” The man ran screaming out of the florist’s shop. The florist picked up his phone. “Hahaha. We sure pranked that guy! How’s the chocolate selling
column12: buddy?” “It’s selling well. It will be selling better whenever you wake up from your coma.” “Haha
column13: yeah right. The joke won’t work on me.” “I’m not joking. You have to wake up! WAKE UP!”  “OH MY GOD!!! AM I IN A COMA?! DID I JUST PRANK A GUY ABOUT BEING IN A  COMA WHEN I IN FACT AM THE ONE IN THE COMA?!?! OH
column15: YOU HAVE TO HELP ME!!! HELP ME by waking up from your coma.” “When everyone’s in a coma
column16: nobody’s in a coma.” “I love our town.”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 159498563129 "2017-04-12 19:03:32 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159498563129/pet "“Dad
column2: I want a dog.”“No.”“Why not?”“What happened to your pet gerbil?”“It died.”“What happened to your pet snake?”“It died.”“What happened to your pet Tupac?”“It pretended to die so it could boost record sales.”“I rest my case.”“I’m gonna make you my pet
column3: dad. Then you’ll die.”“I should have never let you watch that movie with death in it! Curse that movie! Curse What’s Eating Gilbert Grape!”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 159458779044 "2017-04-11 17:44:39 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/159458779044/ice-cream " One summer I built a small ice cream shop near the town pool. I say  shop
column2: but it was more of a me just holding a sign that said “ICE CREAm”  (I never learned how to do a capital M)” than a shop. Regardless
column3: it  became quite successful due to my oddly creative flavors (vanilla
column4: chocolate
column5: The Tonight Dough starring Jimmy Fallon). One day a big ice  cream company tried to buy me out. They drove up in big limo
column6: rolled  down the window
column7: and tossed a big pile of cash at my feet. It was  windy so all the money flew away. They drove around and gathered it  back up and then threw a sealed bag of the money at my feet. By then it  was really windy so the bag flew away. They drove around and picked up  the bag and then just yelled at me through the window
column8: “We’ll give you  $10
column10: the wind was so bad by then that what  I heard was “We’ll (WRRRRRR) you (WRRRRRRR) go (WRRRRRR) you’re gay  (WRRRRRRRRRRRR).” I was going to respond
column11: but I was blown away by the  wind
column12: all my ice cream swirling around me
column13: my sign flapping like one of  those animals with wings (birds? Is that right?). I eventually landed on  the Goodyear blimp
column14: which I found out isn’t actually a blimp
column15: just a  fat balloon. That was the best summer of my life
column17: because I’m now remembering it happened in the fall.  " True text

keatonpatti 162382644734 "2017-06-29 03:51:44 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/162382644734/questions " The bus was empty except for the driver and one passenger. “Tell ya what
column2: ” said the bus driver. “My shift ends after this. Just let me know where ya need to go and I’ll drive ya there.” “Really?” asked the passenger. “Really.” “Wow. Thanks! I’m going to the town graveyard.” “Next stop: the town graveyard! Noticed ya got a shovel with ya. Ya wouldn’t be planning on graverobbing
column3: would ya?” “No. I’m the groundskeeper. I plant flowers to beautify the graveyard.”  “That’s wonderful! However
column4: I did also notice ya got with ya a set of  lockpicking tools
column5: like ya gonna need to break into the graveyard since  it’s after hours. Something a graverobber would do.” “I gave my set  of keys to a poor little old lady who wished to visit her husband’s  grave whenever the whim struck her. Until I get another set
column6: I use these  tools. It’s a skill I learned in the military defending our country  from evil.” “Quite noble! I do hate to bring this up
column7: but ya also  seem to have half of a corpse in ya backpack and you’re removing the  gold rings from its fingers
column8: kinda the definition of graverobbing
column11: is this a bus or the set of Twenty Questions?”  “It’s a bus you fucking moron. Hahah! You thought this could’ve been  the set of a TV show? Are you fucking dense? Have you seen a TV show  set? Guess not because you’re such a fucking moron. Hahahhahaahh! What a  fucking piece of shit! God
column12: get the fuck off of my bus.” “But we’re over a river!” “Sure it’s a river and not a fucking TV set? Hahaha! You punk ass bitch
column13: get the fuck off of my bus.”  The bus driver threw the passenger out of the bus and into the river.  He then sat back down and continued driving. Then he turned directly to  camera. “Stay tuned
column14: we’ll be back with more Twenty Questions!”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 161971945859 "2017-06-18 17:31:13 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161971945859/fathers-day-gift " “Happy Father’s Day! I got ya something.” The son pulled out a gift. “Thanks
column2: son. You didn’t have to do that.” “Oh
column3: okay.” The son threw the gift out of a window. “Son! I live on the 748
column10: crap. I thought you only lived on the 748
column17: remember I moved up to a nicer floor a few years ago because I  saved the landlord’s life by telling him not to eat that Oreo that  clearly was a grenade that only looked like an Oreo?” “I always forget that.”  The gift fell for 1 whole year. It landed in the son’s hand on the next  Father’s Day
column18: which was lucky since he forgot to get his dad a gift  that year. He went up to see his father. “Happy Father’s Day! I got ya something.” The son pulled out a gift. “Thanks
column19: son. You didn’t have to do that.” “Oh
column20: okay.” The son threw the gift out of a window.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 161914488239 "2017-06-17 03:32:06 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161914488239/sponsor "keatonpatti: “One of the most important aspects of AA is choosing a sponsor.”  “I pick Budweiser.”  “No
column2: not a company
column3: a person.”  “Sam Adams.”  “No
column4: someone who will keep you sober.”  “My dad.”  “Perfect
column5: can I have your dad’s number so I can reach out to him?”  “1-800-BeerMan.”  “Your dad has a 1-800 number?”  “Yeah
column6: one day he got drunk and bought one.”  “You know what? I’ll be your sponsor.“  “Fun!” " False text

column1: keatonpatti 161855016074 "2017-06-15 15:33:29 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161855016074/game " “A girl I liked asked me if I wanted to do something. I said ‘I’m game!’ but it sounded like 'I’m gay!’” “Sir
column2: do you even have an account at this bank?” “No
column3: I just wanted to talk to someone.” “Well
column4: I can’t talk to you if you don’t have an account. Do you want to open one?” “I’m game!” “I understand you’re gay
column5: sir
column6: but do you want an account?” “Damn it!” “I’m gay too. ;-)”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 161744636444 "2017-06-12 19:13:22 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161744636444/cocktail " “Can I see a cocktail list?” “Buddy
column2: ‘dis ain’t no fancy-smancy bar. We got beers and we got shots. What ya have?” “Can you do a piña-colada?” “What da fuck is that? Some kinda alien?” “It’s a drink.” “You drink aliens
column3: boy?” “Haha. No
column4: I was—”  “‘Cuz I’d totally be up for drinking an alien
column5: if you got one on ya. My  cousin was abducted a few years back
column6: I feel like drinking one would  make up for that
column7: ya know?” “I don’t have an alien.” “I get ya.  Can’t say it out in the open. Okay
column8: let’s me and you go to the bathroom  and chug that alien real quick. Nobody will know
column9: ‘cept us. Does the  alien taste like root beer? ‘Cuz I don’t like root beer
column10: but I’d still  drink it. Damn alien ruined my cousin’s life. He was gonna be a football  star.” “Now what’s he do?” “He plays for the Dallas Cowboys
column11: but he’s not a star. Just a quality player and all. Fucking aliens!” “Listen
column12: I don’t have an alien to drink. That’s the truth. Now
column13: I’d love a beer. What’s that one there?” “Lagunitas.” “What the fuck is that? Some kinda alien?”  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 161628356239 "2017-06-09 18:22:55 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161628356239/pret "“Sorry to do this job interview at this Pret A Manger
column2: but I love it here.”“It’s no problem.”“Great. So what makes you want to work at Panera?”“Uh
column3: well I think it’s a great company with great food and—”The interviewer leaned over the table.“—not as good as Pret A Manger’s though
column4: right? Haha!”“Um…I think it’s as good.”“No need to lie
column5: kid. Pret’s the best and us at Panera know that! Our food all comes from either the freezer or a really cold refrigerator.”The interviewer took a giant bite out of a Pret sandwich
column6: always made with fresh ingredients.“Well
column7: uh
column8: I also have a friend who works at Panera and he said it’s a good environment.”“Do you also have a friend who works at Pret? That could maybe get a job here? God
column9: I’d love to know someone on the inside!”The interviewer took a giant swig of Pret’s 100% Colombian coffee
column10: brewed fresh every hour or else.“Nope
column11: no Pret friends.”The interviewer frowned and marked down something on the kid’s application.“Your resume says you went to college at PAMU?”“Yeah
column12: Portland Arts & Music University.”“Are you sure it wasn’t Pret A Manger University?”“…yes.”“Positive?”“…yes.”“Think back. Were the classes all held in a Pret A Manger and was your teacher a Pret A Manger employee and was your diploma a napkin from Pret A Manger?”“…oh my god…you’re right.”“I sometimes am!”“Wow. My entire education was a scam. What do I do with my life now?”“You work for Panera
column13: that’s what! You’re hired!”“Really? Thanks!”The interviewer ate a Pret cookie
column16: in a single bite and smiled wide. He didn’t actually have the ability to give the kid a job. Hell
column17: he didn’t even work for Panera. He was just a man who loved Pret A Manger and hated not giving job interviews. Who is to say that he’s any better than you or I? I’m not saying that
column18: so it must be you. You asshole." True text

column1: keatonpatti 161519217929 "2017-06-06 21:12:39 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161519217929/ready " “Okay
column2: are you guys ready for your next stand-up of the night?” “We told you
column3: no!” said the crowd. They were woefully unprepared. “Uhh…well it’s been 15 minutes
column4: I figured you’d be ready by now.” “Well
column5: we’re not! Some of us still need a couple minutes
column6: a few are in the bathroom
column7: and Ted’s arm is asleep!” “I mean
column8: you can still hear comedy if your arm is asleep…” “Ted can’t!” “Jeez. Uh…well are you at least ready to hear the name of your next comic?” “FUCK NO!!!” “Well then what are you ready for?” The crowd whispered to each other for a few seconds. Ted couldn’t hear it due to his arm.  “We’ve come to a decision that we’re ready to be told a riddle about  our next comic. That way by the time we piece together the answer
column9: we  should be ready for it.” “…um…okay…this next comic…can only be seen at night…but only if you don’t look.” The crowd huddled together for 20 minutes. “Okay. We think we know the answer and are ready to find out if we were right. Who is the next comic?” “Your next comic is Dave Attell!”  “WE WERE WRONG!!!!!” The crowd tore the building to pieces and then  tore the pieces to micro-pieces. Dave Attell was grabbed and thrown off a  cliff. He landed in another stand-up club and did a 5 minute set about  the cliff and it killed. Ted sat in his blissful
column10: soundless world and wondered what was going on.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 161475274739 "2017-06-05 18:52:40 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161475274739/replaced " “Sorry
column2: Mel. We’re replacing you.” “What? You found another piano player?”  “No
column3: we’re replacing you with a jukebox. It plays hundreds of songs.  You only know like 3
column4: and 2 of them are the same as the 1st one.” “You trust that machine to keep people entertained? It’ll break down on the first day.”  “So? You normally break down crying halfway through your first song.  Then you yell
column5: ‘EVERYONE JUST PRETEND I’M NOT HERE!’ and all the  customers at the bar have to awkwardly avoid looking at you. The jukebox can’t be as bad as that.” “Yeah
column6: well…someone could steal that thing! Then you’ll be screwed.” “Are YOU planning on stealing it?” “…yes.” “It weighs like 500 pounds.” “I can lift that! I walk past a gym every day!” “Mel
column7: you can’t carry a tune
column8: let alone a 500 pound jukebox.” “Damn
column9: that was good.” “Thank you. I was hoping you’d mention trying to steal the jukebox so I could use it.” “Well I’ll leave now
column10: but could I at least have a free drink before I go?” “Sure
column11: what do you want?” “A bottle of acid that can melt a jukebox.”  The two shared a laugh over that. The jukebox didn’t laugh. The jukebox  only got angry and planned how to kill every human being on Earth. Some  say it’s still planning to this day
column12: and if you listen closely when  that jukebox is playing Kings of Leon’s “Sex On Fire
column14: but nobody ever has because when that song is playing  everybody’s too focused on ROCKING THE FUCK OUT!!!!!!!  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 161400241469 "2017-06-03 20:34:54 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161400241469/rope " The Home Depot guy scanned the rope. “That’ll be $24.54
column2: and sir
column3: you’re  not going to hang yourself with this are you? Sorry
column4: it’s store policy  to ask.” “Huh? Oh. No. I’m using it to build a guillotine.”  “Wow. How French of you
column5: sir. You aren’t going to use the guillotine to  kill yourself are you? Sorry
column6: store policy. If we hear the word  ‘guillotine’ we have to ask.” “Huh? Oh. No. The guillotine’s to chop up firewood in a fun way.” “It does sound fun
column7: in a French sort of way.  You aren’t going to use the firewood to burn yourself at the stake and  kill yourself are you? Sorry
column8: it’s store policy to read into everyone’s  purchases and assume they’re using them to kill themselves. You’d be  surprised how many lives we’ve saved.” “Is it zero?” “Haha. I wish.” “Well
column9: the firewood’s for the children’s camp I volunteer at. We tell ghost stories around the campfire.”  “About French ghosts
column10: I’m sure. But you wouldn’t be telling the ghost  stories in order to unlock past life knowledge in the children
column11: perhaps a  past life as a murderer or executioner
column12: in order to have the children  kill you once the story is finished
column15: yes. That’s obviously what I’m doing
column18: sir. Life is worth living. That’s Home Depot’s motto.” “I thought your motto was ‘Fuck Lowe’s’?” “It was until that motto caused the CEO of Lowe’s to kill himself.” “Wow. How’d he do it?” “He went the ghost story route too.” “Always works.” “100% of the time.” “Never failed.” “Not once.” “Well once it failed.” “Nope.” “You’re right
column19: I was just testing you.” “I’m gonna call you Mr. SAT
column20: because you test people.” “Thanks. I’ve never had a name.”  The man left without any rope
column21: but with a big smile on his face thanks  to the encounter with the cashier. He had never even told the employee  that he was the newest CEO of Lowe’s. He’d do that tomorrow when he  tried to buy the rope again.  " True text

column1: keatonpatti 161324615559 "2017-06-01 19:20:34 GMT" http://keatonpatti.tumblr.com/post/161324615559/cement " “Hey
column2: buddy! You can’t touch that fresh cement!” “Oh. Sorry. I just wanted to write me and my lover’s initials inside a heart.” “Ah! Well
column3: I’ve been in love before
column4: so you know what? Go for it!” “Thanks
column5: man.” The man bends over and writes “TWIZZLERS SUCK” in the wet cement. “All done. Thanks again!” “Wait! What are your initials?” “That’s personal!” “You lied to me! Do you even have a lover?” “Are you hitting on me?” “No!” “So you think I’m ugly?!” “No!” “As Jeff Gordon once said
column6: ‘The lady doth protest too much
column7: methinks!’” “Jeff Gordon didn’t say that! It was Dale Earnhardt! And I’m not a lady!” “Not with that attitude you aren’t!” “I’m cementing over what you wrote now! And by the way
column8: Twizzlers don’t suck.” “Thank you. That was all we needed.” “Huh? What?” “This was a Twizzlers commercial. You just gave us our new tagline. ‘Twizzlers don’t suck.’” “Wow
column9: you were filming all this?” “Sure was! Come out
column10: guys.” Nobody came out. Not a camera guy. Not a sound guy. Not a lighting guy. Not even another type of guy. “…so…uh…am I gonna get paid for being in the commercial.” “Sure are! Gary will pay you now. Come out
column11: Gary!” Nobody came out. Especially not Gary. “…are you…just a crazy person?” “Would a crazy person.” “…are you going to finish that sentence?” He never did finish that sentence.  The commercial was real
column12: of course. It won Commercial of the Year every  year until they ran out of years. As Dale Earnhardt once said
column15: methinks.” RIP Dale.  Beat God in another NASCAR race for us all
column16: will ya? God needs to be  taken down a peg. Maybe even two. Definitely not three.  " True text
